desc: Small things that can change your life...and maybe the world
summary: Admiral William H. McRaven shares ten life lessons from Navy SEAL training that can help anyone overcome challenges and achieve their goals.
review: An inspiring book that turns military discipline into practical life advice.

rawContent.aboutAuthor: Admiral William H. McRaven is a highly decorated retired U.S. Navy SEAL who served for 37 years. He commanded at every level during his career, culminating in his role as Commander of all U.S. Special Operations Forces as a Four-Star Admiral. McRaven's military experience includes leading the operation that resulted in the capture of Saddam Hussein and the raid that led to the death of Osama bin Laden. After retiring from the Navy, he became Chancellor of the University of Texas System. McRaven is known for his leadership skills, strategic thinking, and ability to inspire others, which he has translated into writing and public speaking.
